needroleperm:
Bot noticed that it doesn't have permission to create role. To make bot work properly, you have to allow bot to create role, or it won't react to any users

Bot needs to add initial role called `PackPackMod` which makes it able to recognize moderators. Usually moderators will have permission to assign roles to themselves, so they need to assign this role. After assigning role, call `p!idset` to modify registered role data such as changing moderator role from `PackPackMod` to your server's real moderator role, and making other normal members able to use commands as well

This message is from server named **_**, and automatically sent from bot
maxrole:
Bot noticed that this server already has maximum role number (250), so bot couldn't add new role which is required, so bot can function properly. Please remove one role, and re-invite this bot

This message was sent automatically, from the server **_**
no_perm:
This message is from server : **_SSS_**

Bot noticed that it couldn't send message in the channel where you used the command. Please contact owner or the moderators of this server to adjust bot's permission, or if you are one of them, adjust permission of this bot, so it can send messages
no_permch:
This message is from server : **_SSS_**

Bot noticed that it couldn't send message in the channel called **#_CCC_**. Please contact the owner or the moderators of this server to adjust bot's permission, or if you are one of them, adjust permission of this bot, so it can send messages
first_join:
Hello! Bot noticed that you or someone invited it to the server : **_SSS_**

If you granted bot permission to manage roles, you will be able to see that bot added role called `PackPackMod` role. Bot has strict role system, so users can use commands only when they have proper roles to themselves

It seems that bot couldn't find any moderator role (role which has permission to manage user), so you will have to use `PackPackMod` role to use moderator-only commands

To make members in your server able to use this bot's commands, you have to assign one specific role as `Member` role. Copy ID of role which you want to assign as member role. Then call command like below (You have to assigne `PackPackMod` role to yourself before using this command!) : 

```
p!idset -me [ID]
```
where `[ID]` is role's ID. Then bot will be able to recognize members properly!
first_joinmod:
Hello! Bot noticed that you or someone invited it to the server : **_SSS_**

If you granted bot permission to manage roles, you will be able to see that bot added role called `PackPackMod` role. Bot has strict role system, so users can use commands only when they have proper roles to themselves

It seems that **_MMM_** role is moderator role (role which has permission to manage user), and its ID is _III_. First of all, you will have to give `PackPackMod` role to yourself to use moderator-only commands, and assign this _MMM_ role as proper `Moderator` role to bot

Also, to make members in your server able to use this bot's commands, you have to assign one specific role as `Member` role. Copy ID of role which you want to assign as member role. Then call command like below (You have to assigne `PackPackMod` role to yourself before using this command!) : 

```
p!idset -m _III_ -me [ID]
```
where `[ID]` is role's ID. Then bot will be able to recognize members properly!

help_fixrole_desc: If this server is registered as server where requires role data maintenance, **moderators** can fix incorrect user role data for PackPack. `fr` is also valid command
help_fixrole_argu:
`-p` or `-pre` : Manually decide role which will be added
`-i` or `-ignore` : Decide role which will trigger ignoring. If this role is specified, even though user has none of two roles, bot will ignore them
help_fixrole_tip: Let's say users in server must have one of member or pre-member role. There must not be users who have none of these roles. But sometimes, since usually these role system is managed by other bots, some users may have none of these roles due to inactivity of bot, etc. In that case, moderators can call this command to make such users have correct role data. Moderators must provide role ID. If server isn't registered as server where requires role data maintenance, moderators can't use this command. Ask creator of bot to register this server by using `p!suggest` command or manually contacting
help_watchdm_desc: Activate DM monitor reporting feature, and set channel where reports will be uploaded. **Only moderators can use this command**. `wd` is also valid command
help_watchdm_tip:
As spam link spreading is becoming serious, I decided to add test feature, which monitors bot's DM. If bot gets DM with http link (It can't distinguish if it's scam link or not), it will report to specified channel if user who sent DM is in this server

To deactivate this report, call `p!watchdm`, but without channel ID
help_subscribeevent_desc: Subscribe event data and decide channel where bot will upload new event data. Can subscribe to multiple BC version (EN, TW, KR, JP). **Only moderators can use this command**. `se` is also valid command
help_subscribeevent_argu: `-r` or `-raw` : Show event data without sorting order of date
help_subscribeevent_tip:
After specifying channel, you can subscribe to multiple BC version by passing numbers

1 : BCEN
2 : BCTW
3 : BCKR
4 : BCJP

To unsubscribe, just call only `p!se` without any information
help_printstageevent_desc: Print analyzed stage/event event data. If locale isn't specified, it will print use server's locale automatically. `pse` is also valid command
help_printstageevent_argu:
`-en` : Bring BCEN stage/event data
`-tw` : Bring BCTW stage/event data
`-kr` : Bring BCKR stage/event data
`-jp` : Bring BCJP stage/event data
`-f` or `-full` : Bring full data list instead of newly caught event data
`-r` or `-raw` : Show event data without sorting order of date
`-n` or `-now` : Show only on-going event data considering timezone
help_printgachaevent_desc: Print analyzed gacha event data. If locale isn't specified, it will print use server's locale automatically. `pge` is also valid command
help_printgachaevent_argu:
`-en` : Bring BCEN gacha data
`-tw` : Bring BCTW gacha data
`-kr` : Bring BCKR gacha data
`-jp` : Bring BCJP gacha data
`-f` or `-full` : Bring full data list instead of newly caught event data
`-r` or `-raw` : Show event data without sorting order of date
`-n` or `-now` : Show only on-going event data considering timezone
help_printitemevent_desc: Print analyzed item/sale event data. If locale isn't specified, it will print use server's locale automatically. `pie` is also valid command
help_printitemevent_argu:
`-en` : Bring BCEN item/sale data
`-tw` : Bring BCTW item/sale data
`-kr` : Bring BCKR item/sale data
`-jp` : Bring BCJP item/sale data
`-f` or `-full` : Bring full data list instead of newly caught event data
`-r` or `-raw` : Show event data without sorting order of date
`-n` or `-now` : Show only on-going event data considering timezone
help_checkeventupdate_desc: Check event data right now. If bot could find new event data, it will automatically upload analyzed result to servers. **Only trusted users can use this command**. `ceu` is also valid command
help_printevent_desc: Print all event data (gacha, stage, item). **This command may create long message, so only moderators can use this command to prevent spamming**. `pe` is also valid command
help_printevent_argu:
`-en` : Bring BCEN event data
`-tw` : Bring BCTW event data
`-kr` : Bring BCKR event data
`-jp` : Bring BCJP event data
`-s` : Follow server's locale data
`-f` : Upload full event data instead of only newly caught ones
help_statanalyzer_desc: Analyze stats of unit(s) from raw files and upload stat image with analyzed data. **This command brings quite heavy process and required basic knowledge of data mining of BC, so only trusted can use this command.** `sa` is also valid command
help_statanalyzer_argu:
`-u` or `-uid` : Decide ID of unit
`-l` or `-len` : Decide number of forms of this unit
`-s` or `-second` : Use second unit
`-n` or `-name` : Decide custom name of this unit, must provide same number with number of forms. `,` is separator
`-lv` : Set level of this unit
`-p` or `-proc` : Add data of chance-related abilities
`-a` or `-abil` : Add data of passive abilities
`-t` or `-trait` : Add data of trait
`-c` or `-cell` : Add data which required to be analyzed
`-apk` : Use analyzed apk data, so that you won't need to send raw files tediously
`-en/tw/kr/jp` : Decide BC version which you will use, it will be used only when `-apk` is turned on
help_statanalyzer_exam: `p!sa -u 613 -l 2 -s -lv 50 -n Yamii, Yaminoir -c {[0], Test Data, false, false, false} -t {0, Test Trait} -p {[0, 1, 2], _0_% chance to do something to _1_ for _2_, [f, f, t], 0}`
help_statanalyzer_tip:
This will be the most complicated command and requires basic knowledge of data mining, and access to BC files. I made bot able to handle new data which bot can't catch as possible as I can

Index starts from 0. This index here means index of values in stat file

Data set must be wrapped with {} (i.e. {1, Test Trait})

Arrays must be wrapped with [] (i.e. [1,2,3], [t,t,f])

If array requires boolean data, you don't need to put full `true` or `false`. Just put `t` for `true`, and `f` for `false`, so you can reduce command writing time
help_statanalyzer_adddesc:
This embed message explains detailed explanation of each argument. Below is which types of variable you can put

`int` : Integer, aka number
`string` : String, aka sentence, words, etc
`boolean` : Boolean. You can put only true or false for this type of variable, bot accepts `t` as true, and `f` as false
`array` : Data which can hold several elements. For example, if you want to put 2 elements, write like `[Nâ‚€, Nâ‚]` where Nâ‚“ are numbers or booleans you want to put
`intArray` : Array, but requires only integer as elements
`booleanArray` Array, but requires only boolean as elements
help_statanalyzer_name: You can decide names of this unit manually, or it will just use this unit's ID (i.e. `123-000`). You can pass several names by separating them with comma (`,`). For example, `Yamii, Yaminoir`, etc
help_statanalyzer_abil:
Format : `{index, text} <int, string>`

Use this argument when bot can't handle specific new passive ability
help_statanalyzer_proc:
Format : `{indexArray, format, isTimeUnitArray, ignoreIndex} <intArray, string, booleanArray, int>`

 - ignoreIndex is the index of element which will be checked. If you want to check 1st element, then pass this as `0`. If specified element in array is 0, then bot will consider this unit doesn't have ability, so it won't add description about this data. This is for preventing `0% chance to ...`

 - isTimeUnitArray decides whether specific index of element is time unit (Data which has to be displayed with frame/second unit). If you passed [t, f] as data, when bot writing ability description about first data, it will write data with frame or second data

 - To put data of indexArray into text, you have to wrap with underscores (_), for example, if you want to put 1st data of indexArray, put `_0_`, 2nd will be `_1_`, and so on. For example, if data is [1,2] and you wrote text as `_0_% chance to do for _1_`, then result will be `1% chance to do for 2`
help_statanalyzer_cell:
Format : `{indexArray, name, isTimeUnit, oneLine, ignoreZero} <intArray, string, boolean, boolean, boolean>`

 - oneLine decides whether this cell data will be isolated from other data as single line or not

 - ignoreZero decides whether bot will exclude 0 numbers or not. For example, if data is [4, 5, 0] and ignoreZero is true, then bot will display data as `4, 5`. If not, `4, 5, 0` directly
help_statanalyzer_trait:
Format : `{index, name} <int, string>`

Use this argument when bot can't handle specific new trait
help_registerscamlink_desc: Register scam link to database which will be used to auto-moderate compromised users. This command can affect bot's moderating status, so **only allowed servers' moderators can use this command**. `rsl` is also valid command
help_registerscamlink_tip:
If you are moderator who has permission, and somehow found this, **__don't use this command for fun__**

When registering scam link, try to register link's domain only. For example, if link is `http://something.com/someCode`, then domain will be `http://something.com/`, so you can exclude `someCode` part. This will help bot to moderate users more fluently
help_unregisterscamlink_desc: Unregister scam link from database which will be used to auto-moderate compromised users. This command can affect bot's moderating status, so **only allowed servers' moderators can use this command**. `usl` is also valid command
help_subscribescamlinkdetector_desc: Subscribe to feature of bot, which detects scam link automatically and auto-moderate users who sent links. **Only moderators can use this command**. `ssld` or `ssd` are also valid command
help_subscribescamlinkdetector_argu: `-m` : Decide mute role. Must be provided with its raw numeric ID
help_subscribescamlinkdetector_tip:
This feature was made to establish scam link database, and help moderators to moderate compromised accounts. Moderators can choose 3 kinds of action for them : 

 - Mute
 - Kick (Need reconsidering)
 - Ban (Not recommended)

Moderators must provide mute role ID via `-m` argument if they want to choose mute action. If bot could catch compromised account and if this user is in this server, it will report user to specified report channel. Moderators also can decide to make bot upload info about those who aren't in server as well

Be aware that don't rely on this bot too much. It can do false moderation to users, so too strong action such as ban may lead to bad situation
help_unsubscribescamlinkdetector_desc: Unsubscribe from feature of bot, which detects scam link automatically and auto-moderate users who sent these kinds of links. **Only moderators can use this command**. `usld` or `usd` are also valid command
help_timezone_desc: Register your timezone, so bot can consider your time when using some commands. Timezone relies on GMT format. For example, if you passed 3, then it means GMT+3. If you passed -2, then it means GMT-2. Timezone range is from -12 to 12. `tz` is also valid command
help_optout_desc: Server may be using DM monitor system or scam link detecting feature of this bot. This means that your message may be being tracked, and users should be able to decide whether they will allow bot to track their messages or not. With this command, you can make bot not track your message anymore, but this will make bot not recognize you, and **it cannot be undone**
help_config_desc: Adjust config, so bot can apply your preferences automatically
help_config_tip:
When you call this command, bot will show 5 things which can be adjusted : Language, Default level, Extra information, Unit, Compact embed

**Language** - language is that you can make bot show text with difference supporting language

**Default level** - You can make bot apply specific level automatically without calling `-lv` argument

**Extra information** - You can make bot always show extra information (catfruit evolve data for unit, ex stage data for stage, etc.) without calling `-e` argument

**Unit** - You can make bot always use frame/second unit for time-related data automatically without calling `-s` argument

**Compact embed** - In mobile discord, there's problem that bot floods the chat when showing stat embed. This config merges multiple fields into one field, compressing embed messages without calling `-c` argument
help_downloadapk_desc: Download apk from server directly, and extracts data inside of it. This will be used when you need to analyze stat (`p!sa`) or animation (`p!aa`). `p!da` is also valid command. **Since this process is very heavy, only trusted users can use this command**
help_downloadapk_argu: `-en/jp/tw/kr` : Decide BC version which bot will download and analyze
help_trueformanalyzer_desc: Analyze stats of unit's true form from raw files and upload stat image with analyzed data. **This command brings quite heavy process and required basic knowledge of data mining of BC, so only trusted can use this command.** `tfanalyzer`, 'trueforma', 'tfa' are also valid command
help_trueformanalyzer_argu:
`-u` or `-uid` : Decide ID of unit
`-s` or `-second` : Use second unit
`-n` or `-name` : Decide custom name of this unit, must provide same number with number of forms. `,` is separator
`-lv` : Set level of this unit
`-p` or `-proc` : Add data of chance-related abilities
`-a` or `-abil` : Add data of passive abilities
`-t` or `-trait` : Add data of trait
`-c` or `-cell` : Add data which required to be analyzed
`-apk` : Use analyzed apk data, so that you won't need to send raw files tediously
`-en/tw/kr/jp` : Decide BC version which you will use, it will be used only when `-apk` is turned on
help_trueformanalyzer_exam: `p!tfa -u 665 -s -lv 50 -n Exorcist Cat -c {[0], Test Data, false, false, false} -t {0, Test Trait} -p {[0, 1, 2], _0_% chance to do something to _1_ for _2_, [f, f, t], 0}`
help_trueformanalyzer_tip:
This will be the most complicated command and requires basic knowledge of data mining, and access to BC files. I made bot able to handle new data which bot can't catch as possible as I can

Index starts from 0. This index here means index of values in stat file

Data set must be wrapped with {} (i.e. {1, Test Trait})

Arrays must be wrapped with [] (i.e. [1,2,3], [t,t,f])

If array requires boolean data, you don't need to put full `true` or `false`. Just put `t` for `true`, and `f` for `false`, so you can reduce command writing time
help_enemystatanalyzer_desc: Analyze stats of unit's true form from raw files and upload stat image with analyzed data. **This command brings quite heavy process and required basic knowledge of data mining of BC, so only trusted can use this command.** `estatanalyzer`, `enemysa`, `esa` are also valid command
help_enemystatanalyzer_argu:
`-e` or `-eid` : Decide ID of enemy
`-s` or `-second` : Use second unit
`-n` or `-name` : Decide custom name of enemy
`-m` : Set magnification of this enemy
`-p` or `-proc` : Add data of chance-related abilities
`-a` or `-abil` : Add data of passive abilities
`-t` or `-trait` : Add data of trait
`-c` or `-cell` : Add data which required to be analyzed
`-apk` : Use analyzed apk data, so that you won't need to send raw files tediously
`-en/tw/kr/jp` : Decide BC version which you will use, it will be used only when `-apk` is turned on
help_enemystatanalyzer_exam: `p!esa -e 612 -s -m 200 -n Haniwanwan -c {[0], Test Data, false, false, false} -t {0, Test Trait} -p {[0, 1, 2], _0_% chance to do something to _1_ for _2_, [f, f, t], 0}`
help_enemystatanalyzer_tip:
This will be the most complicated command and requires basic knowledge of data mining, and access to BC files. I made bot able to handle new data which bot can't catch as possible as I can

Index starts from 0. This index here means index of values in stat file

Data set must be wrapped with {} (i.e. {1, Test Trait})

Arrays must be wrapped with [] (i.e. [1,2,3], [t,t,f])

If array requires boolean data, you don't need to put full `true` or `false`. Just put `t` for `true`, and `f` for `false`, so you can reduce command writing time
help_stagestatanalyzer_desc: Analyze stats of stage from raw files and upload stat image with analyzed data. **This command brings qutie heavy process and requires basic knowledge of data mining of BC, so only trusted can use this command.** `sstatanalyzer`, `stagesa`, `ssa` are also valid command
help_stagestatanalyzer_argu:
`-m` or `-mid` : Decide ID of map, for example, 1278, 2180, etc.
`-c` or `-code` : Decide code of map, such as `S`, `C`, etc.
`-s` or `-second` : Use second unit
`-n` or `-name` : Decide custom name of stages
`-lv` : Set level of these stages
`-en/tw/kr/jp` : Decide BC version which you will use
`-r` or `-range` : Decide which stages you will analyze specifically
help_stagestatanalyzer_tip:
This analyzer uses apk file automatically unlike other analyzers due to its complexity

Map ID here isn't just index of map collection. Each map collection code has their own numeric value. For example, code `S` is 1000, `E` is 4000, etc. You have to include this numeric code value, so that ID's format becomes `Code value + Index value`

If code is same with map code of Gauntlet Stage (RA), or Collaboration Gauntlet Stage (CA), it will generate 10s stages only (1, 11, 21, ..., and max)

When deciding range of stage that will be analyzed, you can pass stage ID, with `,` (i.e. `1, 2, 4`). Or, you can perform range with `-` (i.e. `1-3, 4-6` = `1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6`). For example, combination of these two will be `1, 3, 5-8, 10`, then bot will analyze only stage `1, 3, 5, 6, 7, 8, 10`
help_serverconfig_desc: Adjust config of server, so bot can apply preferences automatically. **Only moderators can use this command.** `serverc`, `sconfig`, `sc` are also valid command
help_serverconfig_tip:
When you call this command, bot will show 5 things which can be adjusted : Language, Default level, Extra information, Unit, Compact embed

**Language** - language is that you can make bot show text with difference supporting language

**Default level** - You can make bot apply specific level automatically without calling `-lv` argument

**Extra information** - You can make bot always show extra information (catfruit evolve data for unit, ex stage data for stage, etc.) without calling `-e` argument

**Unit** - You can make bot always use frame/second unit for time-related data automatically without calling `-s` argument

**Compact embed** - In mobile discord, there's problem that bot floods the chat when showing stat embed. This config merges multiple fields into one field, compressing embed messages without calling `-c` argument
help_commandban_desc: Make the bot ignore specified user's command calls to prevent abusing it. **Only moderators can use this command.** `cb` is also valid command
help_commandunban_desc: Allow user who banned from using this bot to use commands back. **Only moderators can use this command.** `cub` is also valid command
help_ignorechannelpermission_desc: Make bot ignore specific channel permission set for this user to prevent abusing privileges to use commands in wider channels. **Only moderators can use this command.** `ichannelpermission`, `ignorechp`, `ichp` are also valid commands
help_ignorechannelpermission_argu:
`-me` or `-member` : Ignore channel permission set of assigned Member role
`-c` or `-custom` : Ignore channel permission set of assigned custom role. Must come with custom role name, wrapped with "
help_ignorechannelpermission_tip: Channel permission system is that moderators can make users able to use commands only in specific channel when having satisfying role. You can make bot ignore assigned channel permission set despite user having connected role with
help_allowchannelpermission_desc: Make bot consider specific channel permission set for this user back. **Only moderators can use this command.** `achannelpermission`, `allowchp`, `achp` are also valid commands
help_allowchannelpermission_argu:
`-me` or `-member` : Allow channel permission set of assigned Member role
`-c` or `-custom` : Allow channel permission set of assigned custom role. Must come with custom role name, wrapped with "
help_allowchannelpermission_tip: Channel permission system is that moderators can make users able to use commands only in specific channel when having satisfying role. You can make bot consider assigned channel permission set back for this user
help_talentinfo_desc: Try to search talent of this unit with specified name, and upload info of it if exists. `ti` is also valid command
help_soul_desc: Upload animation of soul with specified ID. `sl` is also valid command
help_soul_argu:
`-d` : Enable debug mode
`-f` or `-fr` : Decide end frame of animation
`-r` or `-raw` : Generate animation with mp4 format for high-res result. Cool down will be increased to 1 min. **Only trusted users can use this argument because it's quite heavy process**
`-g` or `-gif` : Make bot bring cached gif link or generate gif result
help_soulimage_desc: Upload image of soul with specified ID. `soulimg`, `simage`, `simg` are also valid command
help_soulimage_argu:
`-t` : Display image with transparent mode
`-d` or `-debug` : Enable debug mode
`-f` or `-fr` : Decide frame of animation
help_soulsprite_desc: Upload sprite of soul with specified ID. `soulsp`, `ssprite`, `ssp` are also valid command

boorole_max: This server has maximum number of roles (250), so bot couldn't add booster role!
fixrole_confirm: If user doesn't have neither of <@&_PPP_> nor <@&_MMM_>, bot will add <@&_PPP_> to this user. This cannot be undone, are you sure?
fixrole_confirmig: If user doesn't have neither of <@&_PPP_> nor <@&_MMM_>, bot will add <@&_PPP_> to this user. However, even though this user have none of these two roles, if user has <@&_III_>, bot won't add role. This cannot be undone, are you sure that you want to run this command?
fixrole_nofixing: This server isn't registered as server which requires role data maintenance. Ask bot creator <@_> (_) to register this server via manually contacting or using `p!suggest` command
fixrole_noneed: All users had proper role data
fixrole_fixed: Fixed _ users who had incorrect role data
watdm_remove: Removed DM monitor reporting channel data!
watdm_nochan: No channel is specified. Specify the channel via mention or passing channel ID
watdm_nonum: Channel ID is not a number
watdm_invalid: Invalid channel ID, no such channel found in this server
watdm_set: DM monitor reporting channel is set as <#_> (_)!
watdm_suslink: I got DM which may contain suspicious link
subevent_set: Successfully subscribed event data news of _BC_! New event data will be uploaded in <#_CCC_> (_CCC_)!
printstage_toolong: Uploading raw file because stage/event data was too long
printgacha_toolong: Uploading raw file because gacha dat was too long
printitem_toolong: Uploading raw file because item/sale data was too long
stat_uid: Please specify ID of the unit you want to analyze
stat_name: Not enough names | Number of forms : _RRR_ | Number of names : _PPP_
scamreg_noperm: This server doesn't have permission to manage scam link database. Contact developer of PackPack manually to get permission via `p!suggest`
scamreg_invlink: Invalid scam link format found. Link must be start with `http://` or `https://`
scamreg_already: This link was already registered into database
subscam_noid: Channel ID not provided. You have to provide channel where bot will report compromised account information
subscam_invalidch: Channel ID has invalid format, you have to mention channel or manually provide ID of it
subscam_nosuch: No such channel found. Channel must be existing text channel
subscam_decide:
Before subscribing scam link auto-detector, you have to decide some options

Action when bot could catch compromised account = **Mute**
 - Bot will remove all roles from this user, and add provided mute role ID

Bot will upload info message if bot could catch compromised account from other server, and this user is in this server as well
subscam_before: Before subscribing scam link auto-detector, you have to decide some options
subscam_actionmute:
Action when bot could catch compromised account = **Mute**
 - Bot will remove all roles from this user, and add provided mute role ID
subscam_actionkick:
Action when bot could catch compromised account = **Kick**
 - Bot will directly kick this user. Consider the situation when bot caught non-scam link before selecting this action
subscam_actionban:
Action when bot could catch compromised account = **Ban**

**__:warning: Warning! :warning:__**

Banning user directly may lead to bad situation when bot caught non-scam link. It's not recommended, so consider using other options
subscam_noticex: Bot will upload info message if bot could catch compromised account from other server, and this user is in this server as well
subscam_noticeall: Bot will always upload info message if bot could catch compromised account from other server, whether this user is in this server or not
subscam_nomute: To select mute action, you should have to provide mute role ID via `-m` argument. Cancel this command, and call again with mute role ID
subscam_done: Now bot will upload compromised account information new in <#_>
subscam_notreg: This server didn't subscribe scam link auto-detector
noticex: Compromised users in this server only
scamhandle_descmute: Bot caught that user sent message with one of scam link in database, so muted this user
scamhandle_desckick: Bot caught that user sent message with one of scam link in database, so kicked this user
scamhandle_descban: Bot caught that user sent message with one of scam link in database, so banned this user
scamhandle_kickreason: Kicked user because this user sent scam link in message
scamhandle_banreason: Banned user because this user sent scam link in message
scamhandle_dm:
Bot took action because it detected that you sent scam link in message. If this is false, contact moderator manually

Server : _NNN_ (_III_)
scamhandle_reportdesc:
Bot detected compromised account in the other server, and this user is in this server as well. Please take action to them before they spread more scam links to others

Caught link : _
scamhandle_reportdescall:
Bot detected compromised account in the other server, but this user isn't in this server for now

Caught link : _
timezone_noval: Not enough parameter! You have to specify the timezone you want to set. Timezone must be GMT (i.e `p!tz 3` = GMT+3, `p!tz -10` = GMT-10)
timezone_notnum: Timezone value must be numeric! (i.e `p!tz 3` = GMT+3, `p!tz -10` = GMT-10)
timezone_done: Your timezone is now set as GMT_!
timezone_nomem: Couldn't register timezone because bot couldn't get your member information
optout_warn:
**__Read this warning__**

You called this command because you didn't want your data to be collected (your Discord ID number). Bot won't collect your data anymore, but this means that bot won't be able to function normally for you, and won't recognize you even though you call commands of it

**__This cannot be undone__**, you can undo it only by contacting developer of PackPack manually (Support server link in privacy policy below). Are you sure that you want to opt out?

Link : https://github.com/battlecatsultimate/PackPack/blob/main/Privacy%20Policy.md
config_deflvdesc: When you call `p!fs` command, bot will apply Lv. _ automatically to unit instead of 30
config_extrue: When you call `p!fs`, `p!es`, `p!si` command, bot will always automatically show extra information without calling `-e` argument
config_exfalse: When you call `p!fs`, `p!es`, `p!si` command, you will have to manually use `-e` argument to see extra information
config_unitdesc: When bot shows unit/enemy/stage stats, all time-related data will be shown with unit above
config_expire: Config change canceled due to time out
config_comtrue: When you call `p!fs`, `p!es`, `p!si`, `p!fst` command, bot will compress stat embed without calling `-c` argument, so when you are on mobile Discord, it won't flood the chat
config_comfalse: When you call `p!fs`, `p!es`, `p!si`, `p!fst` command, you have to call `-c` argument to see compressed stat embed
config_force: Force users to follow server's compact mode : _
config_fortrue:
Normally, personal config overrides server's default config. However, since server may be using compact mode due to bot flooding the chat, moderators can force users to use compact mode specially

Users will have to follow server's default from now on for compact mode
config_forfalse:
